rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.
rev.diff:
Line 955: Line 955:
=== New Municipality ===
=== New Municipality ===
â
[[File:Official Seal of Sogod, Southern Leyte.gif|left|thumb|155px|Official Seal of the Municipality of Sogod]]
 
Sogod was founded by the Jesuit missionaries as a mission in '''1616'''.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.admu.edu.ph/offices/mirlab/panublion/r8_leytesouth.html#sogod|title= Sogod's foundation by missionaries|publisher= http://www.admu.edu.ph|accessdate=May 4, 2011}}</ref> It was at the baptism of Datu Mangkaw, the village chieftain and his household, that Father Fabricio Sersali laid the foundation of the [[Christian faith]] in Sogod.<ref>{{cite book |title= Southern Leyte (Book II - Towns)|last= Chong|first= Joaquin|year= 1996|location= Maasin City, Southern Leyte|page= 51|accessdate=1996}}</ref> A church of light materials was constructed near the seashore, and a mission was established and serviced by the [[Jesuits]] from [[Carigara]], [[Hilongos]] and [[Cabalian]] ''Residencias''. During the [[Muslim]] raids in 1603 and 1634, the church was burned and Father Ventura Barcena was brought as captive in [[Tawi-Tawi]]. In 1634, during a [[Moro people|Moro]] raid Father Francisco Lauzon was killed and Sogod was subject to frequent Moro raids as it faced Mindanao. Another incident occurred again on September 27, 1705, when the [[Moro people|Moros]] attack the seashore and killed Father Pedro Oriel. On account of this, the [[Jesuit missionaries]] in Cabalian (San Juan) undertook the construction of the concrete church and a watchtower in 1718 upon the order of Bishop Sebastian Faronda, Diocese of [[Cebu]] (now [[Archdiocese of Cebu]]. In 1720, the [[Jesuits]] formally assigned priests into the settlement together with the newly constructed watchtower and concrete church. These were razed to the ground and the ''Kampanang Bulaw'' (Golden Bell) was thrown into the rice fields when the Moros returned and raided Sogod in 1754.
Sogod was founded by the Jesuit missionaries as a mission in '''1616'''.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.admu.edu.ph/offices/mirlab/panublion/r8_leytesouth.html#sogod|title= Sogod's foundation by missionaries|publisher= http://www.admu.edu.ph|accessdate=May 4, 2011}}</ref> It was at the baptism of Datu Mangkaw, the village chieftain and his household, that Father Fabricio Sersali laid the foundation of the [[Christian faith]] in Sogod.<ref>{{cite book |title= Southern Leyte (Book II - Towns)|last= Chong|first= Joaquin|year= 1996|location= Maasin City, Southern Leyte|page= 51|accessdate=1996}}</ref> A church of light materials was constructed near the seashore, and a mission was established and serviced by the [[Jesuits]] from [[Carigara]], [[Hilongos]] and [[Cabalian]] ''Residencias''. During the [[Muslim]] raids in 1603 and 1634, the church was burned and Father Ventura Barcena was brought as captive in [[Tawi-Tawi]]. In 1634, during a [[Moro people|Moro]] raid Father Francisco Lauzon was killed and Sogod was subject to frequent Moro raids as it faced Mindanao. Another incident occurred again on September 27, 1705, when the [[Moro people|Moros]] attack the seashore and killed Father Pedro Oriel. On account of this, the [[Jesuit missionaries]] in Cabalian (San Juan) undertook the construction of the concrete church and a watchtower in 1718 upon the order of Bishop Sebastian Faronda, Diocese of [[Cebu]] (now [[Archdiocese of Cebu]]. In 1720, the [[Jesuits]] formally assigned priests into the settlement together with the newly constructed watchtower and concrete church. These were razed to the ground and the ''Kampanang Bulaw'' (Golden Bell) was thrown into the rice fields when the Moros returned and raided Sogod in 1754.
Line 1,020: Line 1,019:
=== The Creation of the Municipality of Libagon ===
=== The Creation of the Municipality of Libagon ===
{{Main|Libagon, Southern Leyte}}
{{Main|Libagon, Southern Leyte}}
â
[[File:Official Seal of the Municipality of Libagon.jpg|155px|left|thumb|Official Seal of the Municipality of Libagon]]
 
The municipality of Libagon is a 4th class municipality in the province of Southern Leyte, having a total population of 14, 238, as of 2007.
The municipality of Libagon is a 4th class municipality in the province of Southern Leyte, having a total population of 14, 238, as of 2007.
Line 1,037: Line 1,035:
=== The Creation of the Municipality of Bontoc ===
=== The Creation of the Municipality of Bontoc ===
{{Main|Bontoc, Southern Leyte}}
{{Main|Bontoc, Southern Leyte}}
â
[[File:Official Seal of the Municipality of Bontoc.jpg|155px|left|thumb|Official Seal of the Municipality of Bontoc]]
+
The municipality of Bontoc has a total population 27,592 inhabitants in 5,303 households. The town houses the Southern Leyte State University â Bontoc Campus, which offers agricultural and industrial courses. Its inhabitants are closely related with its mother municipality, Sogod, because of its distance.
The municipality of Bontoc has a total population 27,592 inhabitants in 5,303 households. The town houses the Southern Leyte State University â Bontoc Campus, which offers agricultural and industrial courses. Its inhabitants are closely related with its mother municipality, Sogod, because of its distance.
